snippet: Young people still watch many television shows, but they are streaming them on computers and phones to a greater degree.
abstract: Nielsen is poised to release data showing that Americans ages 12 to 34 are spending less time watching television, even as those 35 and older spend more; young people still watch many television shows, but they are streaming them on computers and phones to a greater degree than their parents or grandparents, a trend could cause billions of dollars in annual advertising to shift away from TV..
lead_paragraph: Young people still watch many television shows, but they are streaming them on computers and phones to a greater degree.

headline.seo: Young People Are Watching, but Less Often on TV
headline.main: Youths Are Watching, but Less Often on TV
headline.print_headline: Youths Are Watching, But Less Often on TV
